Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

1us vexillat[or] Now gracyous god groundyd of all goodnesse as Ã¾i grete glorie nevyr be-gynning had So Ã¾ou socour and saue all Ã¾o Ã¾at sytt and sese and lystenyth to oure talkyng with sylens stylle and sad Ffor we purpose us pertly stylle in Ã¾is prese Ã¾e pepyl to plese with pleys ful glad now lystenyth us louely bothe more and lesse Gentyllys and ?emanry of goodly lyff lad Ã¾is tyde we xal ?ou shewe as Ã¾at we kan how Ã¾at Ã¾is werd ffyrst be-gan and how god made bothe molde and man Iff Ã¾at ?e wyl a[byde.] 2us vexilla[tor] In Ã¾e ffyrst pagent we Ã¾enke to play how god dede make Ã¾urowe his owyn myth hevyn so clere upon Ã¾e fyrst day and Ã¾er in he sett Angell fful bryth Than Angell with songe Ã¾is is no nay xal worchep god as it is ryth but lucyfer Ã¾at Angell so gay in suche pompe Ã¾an is he pyth and set in so gret pride Ã¾at goddys sete he gynnyth to take hese lordys pere hym self to make but Ã¾an he ffallyth a ffend ful blake ffrom hevyn in helle to a[byde.] 3us vexill[ator] In Ã¾e secunde pagent by godys myth we Ã¾enke to shewe and pley be-dene in Ã¾e other sex days by opyn syth what Ã¾enge was wrought Ã¾er xal be sene How best was made and foule of flyth and last was man made as I wene Of mannys o ryb as I ?ow plyth was woman wrought mannys make to bene and put in paradyse Ther were flourys bothe blewe and blake of all frutys Ã¾ei myth Ã¾er take Saff frute of cunnyng Ã¾ei xulde for-sake And towche it no wyse. The Serpent toke Eve an Appyl to byte and Eve toke Adam a mursel of Ã¾e same whan Ã¾ei had do Ã¾us a-?ens Ã¾e rewle of ryte than was oure lord wroth and grevyd al with grame Oure lord gan appose Ã¾em of Ã¾er gret debyte both to Askuse hem of Ã¾at synful blame and Ã¾an almythy god ffor Ã¾at gret dyspite Assygned hem grevous peyn as ?e xal se in game In dede Seraphyn An Angell gay with brennyng swerd Ã¾is is verray From paradise bete hem a-way in bybyl as we rede. 1us vexillator We purpose to shewe in Ã¾e thryd pagent the story of Caym and of hese brother Abelle of here tythyngys now be we bent In Ã¾is pagent Ã¾e trewth to telle How Ã¾e tythyng of Abel with feyr was brent and accept to god yf ?e wyl dwelle We purpose to shewe as we haue ment and how he was kyllyd of his brother so felle And than how Caym was cursyd in al degre of godys owyn mowthe Ã¾er xal ?e se of trewe tythyng Ã¾is may wel be exawple to every man. 2us vexilator The iijd e pagent is now ?ow tolde Ã¾e ffourte pagent of Noe xal be how god was wroth with man on molde because fro synne man dede not fle He sent to Noe An Angel bolde A shyp ffor to makyn and swymmen on Ã¾e se vpon Ã¾e water both wood and coolde And viij sowles Ã¾er savyd xulde be And i peyre of everich bestys in brynge whan xlt i days Ã¾e flode had fflowe Ã¾an sente Noe out a crowe and After hym he sent a dowe Ã¾at brouth ryth good tydyng. 3us vexil[lator] Of Abraham is Ã¾e fyfte pagent and of ysaac his sone so fre how Ã¾at he xulde with fere be brent and slayn with swerd as ?e xal se Abraham toke with good A-tent his sone ysaac and knelyd on kne his suerd was than ful redy bent and thouth his chylde Ã¾er offered xuld be Vpon An hyll full Ryff than god toke tent to his good wyl and sent An Angel ryth sone hym tyl and bad Abraham a shep to kyl And sauyd his chyldys lyff. 1us vexil[lator] The sexte pagent is of Moyses and of tweyn tabelys Ã¾at god hym took in Ã¾e which were wrete with-out les Ã¾e lawes of god to lerne and lok and how god charged hym be wordys these Ã¾e lawes to lerne al of Ã¾at book Moyses than doth nevyr more sese but prechyth duly bothe ?ere and woke The lawes as I ?ow telle Ã¾e ten comaundementys alle be-dene In oure play ?e xal hem sene to alle Ã¾o Ã¾at Ã¾ere wyl bene If Ã¾at ?e thenke to duelle. 2us vexillator Off Ã¾e gentyl Jesse rote Ã¾e sefnt pagent for sothe xal ben out of Ã¾e which doth sprynge oure bote as in prophecye we redyn and sen Kyngys and prophetys with wordys fful sote Schull prophesye al of a qwen Ãe which xal staunch oure stryff and moote And wynnen us welthe with-outyn wen In hevyn to Abyde they xal prophecye of a mayde All ffendys of here xal be Affrayde here sone xal saue us be not dismayde With hese woundys wyde. 3us vexillator Of Ã¾e grete bushop Abyacar Ã¾e tende pagent xal be with-out lesyng Ã¾e which comaundyth men to be war and brynge here douterys to dew weddyng All Ã¾at ben xiiij ?ere and more to Maryage he byddyth hem bryng wher evyr Ã¾ei be he chargyth sore Ãat Ã¾ei not ffayle for no lettyng Ãe lawe byddyth so than Than Joachym and anne so mylde Ãei brynge forthe mary Ã¾at blyssyd chylde but she wold not be de-fylyde with spot nor wem of man. I chastyte Ã¾at blysful mayde A-vowyd there here lyff to lede Ã¾an is Ã¾e busshop sore dysmayde And wonderyth sore al of Ã¾is dede he knelyd to god as it is sayde and prayth than for help and rede Ã¾an seyth an Angel be not a-frayde of Ã¾is dowte take Ã¾ou no drede but for Ã¾e kynrede of dauyd Ã¾ou sende lete hem come with here offryng And in here handys white ?erdys brynge loke whose ?erde doth ffloure and sprynge And he xal wedde Ã¾at mayden hende. 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xt e pagent sothe to say A masangere fforthe is sent Dauyd is kynrede with-out de-lay they come fful sone with good Entent Whan joseph offeryd his ?erde Ã¾at day Anon ryth fforth in present Ã¾e ded styk do floure fful gay and Ã¾an joseph to wedlok went Ryth as Ã¾e Angel bad Than he plyth to his wyff In chastyte to ledyn here lyff Ã¾e busshop toke here iij maydonys ryff Som comforte Ã¾ere she had. 2us vexillator In Ã¾e xid e pagent goth Gabryell And doth salute oure lady ffre Than grett with chylde as I ?ow tell Ã¾at blyssyd mayde for sothe is she Ã¾o iij maydenys Ã¾at with here dwelle here gret spech but noon Ã¾ei se than they suppose Ã¾at sum Angell goddys masangere Ã¾at it xuld be And thus Ãe holy gost in here is lyth and goddys sone in here is pygth Ã¾e Aungell doth telle what he xal hyght And namyth Ã¾e chylde jhesus. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xij pagent as I ?ow telle Joseph comyth hom fro fer countre Oure ladyes wombe with chylde doth swelle and Ã¾an joseph ful hevy is he He doth forsake here with hert ful felle out of countre he gynnyth to fle he nevyr more thenkyth with here to dwelle and than oure lady ryth sore wepyth she An Angell seyd hym ryf god is with Ã¾i wyff sertayn Ã¾erfore Joseph turne hom a-gayn Ã¾an is Joseph in herte ful fayn And goth a-geyn onto his wyff. 1us vexillator The xiiijt e pagent I sey ?ow be-dene xal be of joseph and mylde mary how they were sclawndryd with trey and tene and to here purgacion Ã¾ei must hem hy. 2us vexillator In Ã¾e xv pagent shewe we xal how joseph went with-oute varyauns for mydwyuys to helpe oure lady at all of childe that she had delyuerauns. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xvj pagent Cryst xal be born of Ã¾at joy Aungelys xul synge and telle Ã¾e shepherdys in Ã¾at morn the blysseful byrth of Ã¾at kyng The shepherdys xal come hym be-fforn with reuerens and with worchepyng ffor he xal sauyn Ã¾at was for-lorn and graunt us lyf evyr more lestyng i-wys Ã¾is gle in gryth is mater of myrth now crystys byrth Bryng us to his blys. 1us vexillator The xvt e pagent come kyngys iii with gold myrre and ffrankynsens kyng herowdys styward hem doth se And bryngyth all to his presens The kyngys of Coleyn with hert ful ffre tolde kyng herownde here dylygens that Ã¾ei south in Ã¾at countre A kyng of kyngys ffrom fere thens A sterre led hem Ã¾e way The Chylde is ?oung and lyth in stall he xal be kyng of kyngys all beffore hym we thynk on kne to fall And worchep hym Ã¾is day. 2us vexillator In Ã¾e xvi pagent as wroth as wynde is kyng herownde Ã¾e soth to say And cruel knytys and vn-kende to sle male chylderyn he sendyth Ã¾at day But cryst jhesu Ã¾ei may not ffynde Ffor joseph hath led Ã¾at childe away Vnto Egypth as we haue mende As Angel to joseph dyd byd and say In hy?ht Ã¾o chylderyn Ã¾at syt in here moderys lap to sowkyn ful swetly here moderys pap Ã¾e knythtys do sle hem euyn at A swap Ã¾is is a rewly syth. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xvii pagent Ã¾e knythtys be-dene Shull brynge dede childeryn be-for Ã¾e kyng whan kyng herownde Ã¾at syth hath sene fful glad he is of here kyllyng Than kyng herownde with-owtyn wene is sett to mete at his lykyng in his most pride xal come gret tene As ?e xal se at oure pleyng his sorwe xal a-wake whan he is sett at hese most pryde Sodeyn deth xal thrylle his syde and kylle his knyttys Ã¾at with hym byde Ã¾e devyl Ã¾er soulys xal take. 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xviii pagent we must purpose to shewe whan cryst was xij ?er of Age how in Ã¾e temple he dede appose and answerd doctoris ryth wyse and sage The blyssyd babe with-owte glose ouer cam olde clerkys with suych langage Ã¾at Ã¾ei meveylyd ?e xal suppose how Ã¾at he cam to suche knowlage and in Ã¾is whyle thre days he was oute ffro his modyr with-out doute wepyng she sowth hym rownde aboute jherusalem many a myle. 2us vexillator in Ã¾e xix pagent xal seynt jhon baptyse cryst as I ?ow say in Ã¾e watyr of flom jordon with which devys as we best may The holy gost xal ouyr hym on Ã¾e ffaderys voys xal be herd Ã¾at day out of hevyn Ã¾at blisful tron Ã¾e fadyr xal be herd Ã¾is is no nay and forth with pleyn Ã¾e holy gost xal be his gyde in to desert Ã¾er-in to A-byde xlt i days A terme ful wyde and xlt i nygthtys to faste sarteyn. 3us vexillator in Ã¾e xxt i pagent all Ã¾e deuelys of helle they gadere a parlement as ?e xal se they haue gret doute Ã¾e trewth to telle Of cryst jhesu whath he xulde be They Sende Ssathan Ã¾at Ffynde so Ffelle Cryst for to tempte in fele degre We xal ?ow shewe if ?e wyl dwelle How cryst was temptyd in synnys thre Of Ã¾e devyl sathan And how cryst Answeryd on to Alle and made Ã¾e fende awey to falle As we best may Ã¾is shewe we xalle Thorwe grace of god and man 1us vexillator The xxit i pagent of a woman xal be Ã¾e which was take in Adultrye The pharysewys ffalsed Ã¾er ?e xal se Cryst to convycte how they were slye they conseyvyd Ã¾is sotylte yf cryst Ã¾is woman dede dampne trewly A-geyn his prechyng than dede he Which was of pete and of mercy And yf he dede here save Ã¾an were he A-?ens moyses lawe Ã¾at byddyth with stonys she xulde be slawe Ã¾us they thowth vndyr Ã¾er Awe Cryst jhesu for to haue. 2us vexillator The grettest meracle Ã¾at evyr jhesus In erthe wrouth be-forn his passyon In xxiit i pagent we purpose vs to shewe in dede Ã¾e declaracion Ã¾at pagent xal be of lazarus In whos place and habytacion Cryst was logyd Ã¾e gospel seyth thus and ofte tyme toke Ã¾er consolacion but ?yt Lazarus As I ?ow say was iiij days ded and beryed in clay ffrom deth to lyve Ã¾e iiijt e day Cryst reysed hym ffrom Ã¾at pyt. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xxiijt i pagent palme sunday in pley we purpose ffor to shewe how chylderyn of Ebrew with flowrys ful gay Ã¾e wey Ã¾at cryst went Ã¾ei gun to strewe 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xxiiijt i pagent as Ã¾at we may cryst and his apostelys alle on rewe the mawnde of god Ã¾er xal they play and sone declare it with wordys ffewe And than Judas Ã¾at fals traytour ffor xxxt i platys of werdly tresour xal be-tray oure savyour to Ã¾e jewys certan. 2us vexillator ffor grevous peyn Ã¾is is no les in Ã¾e xxvt i pagent cryst xal pray to Ã¾e fadyr of hevyn Ã¾at peyn for to ses his shamful deth to put Away Judas Ã¾at traytour be-for gret pres xal kys his mouth and hym be-tray All his dyscyples than do dyscres and forsake cryst Ã¾e soth to say ffor doute Ã¾ei do hem hede hese dyscyplys all every-chon do renne awey and leve hym alon they lete hym stondyn amonge his ffon And ronne Away ffor drede. 3us vex[illator] Than in Ã¾e xxvjt i pagent to Cayphas cryst xal be brouth Ã¾o jewys fful redy Ã¾er xul be bent Cryst to Acuse with worde and thouth Seynt petyr doth folwe with good intent to se with cryst what xuld be wrouth Ffor crystys dyscyple whan he is hent thryes he doth swere he knew hym nowth A kok xal crowe and crye Than doth petyr gret sorwe make Ffor he his lord Ã¾us dede for-sake But god to grace hym sone doth take Whan he doth aske mercye. 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xxvij pagent sere Pylat Is sett in sete as hy justyce Whan he is set in his astat thre thevys be brout of synful gyse And cryst Ã¾at louyd nevyr stryff nor bat but trewth and goodnesse on every wyse as for a thef with ryth gret hat is browth to stondyn at Ã¾at same syse And Ã¾an as I ?ow say coveryd with clothis al of Ã¾e best the Wyff of Pylat goth to rest Than for to slepe she is ful prest All Ã¾is we thenke to play. 2us vexillator in Ã¾e xxviijt i pagent xal judas Ã¾at was to cryst a ffals traytour with wepyng sore evyr crye Alas Ã¾at evyr he solde oure savyour He xal be sory ffor his trespas And brynge a-?en all his tresour all xxx pens to sere Cayphas he xal them brynge with gret dolowre Ffor Ã¾e which cryst was bowth Ffor gret whanhope as ?e xal se he hangyth hym self vpon a tre Ffor he noth trostyth in godys pete to helle his sowle is browth. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xxix pagent to Pylatus Wyff in slepe aperyth Ã¾e devyl of helle ffor to savyn crystys lyff The devyl here temptyth as I ?ow telle Sche sendyth to pylat a-non ful ryff And prayth Ã¾at cryst he xuld not qwelle Ã¾an pylat is besy and ryth blyff cryst for to savyn he ?evyth councelle ffor he dede neuyr trespas The jewys do crye fast ffor to kylle the rythful man Ã¾ei aske to spylle A thef Ã¾ei saue with herty wylle Ã¾at Callyd is barrabas. 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xxxt i pagent Ã¾ei bete out crystys blood And nayle hym al nakyd upon a rode tre betwen ij thevys i-wys they were to wood they hyng cryst jhesu gret shame it is to se vii wurdyes cryst spekyth hangyng upon Ã¾orwe godys myth how to crystys herte a spere gan pace and rent oure lordys bryst in ruly plyth Ffor longeus Ã¾at olde knyth blynd as he was A ryth sharpe spere to cristys herte xal pyth Ã¾e blod of And ?it be his owyn myth The body Ã¾at was hevy as led be Ã¾e jewys nevyr so qwed A-ryseth from grave Ã¾at Ã¾er lay ded And ffrayth than every knyth. 1us vexillator in Ã¾e xxiij pagent Ã¾e soule of hefne so cler In herte sche hath ryth glad chere whan here sone Ã¾us doth apere here care awey is tan. 2us vexillator in Ã¾e xxxiiiit i pagent xal maryes thre seke cryst jhesu in his grave so coolde An Aungel hem tellyth Ã¾at aresyn is he and whan Ã¾at Ã¾is tale to them is tolde To crystys dyscyplis with wurdys fful fre they telle these tydyngys with brest ful bolde than petyr and johan as ?e xal se down rennyn in hast ouer lond and wolde The trewth of Ã¾is to haue whan Ã¾ei Ã¾er comyn as I ?ow say he is gon ffrom vndyr clay Ã¾an Ã¾ai wytnesse a-noon Ã¾at day he lyth not in his grave. 3us vexillator On to Mary Mawdelyn as we haue bent Cryst jhesu xal than Apere In Ã¾e xxxvt i pagent and she wenyth he be A gardenere Mary be name verament Whan cryst here callyth with spech ful clere She ffallyth to ground with good entent to kys his fete with gladsom chere but cryst byddyth here do way he byddyth his feet Ã¾at sche not kys tyl he haue styed to hefne blys to crystys dyscyplys mary i-wys than goth Ã¾e trewth to say. 1us vexillator In Ã¾e xxxvjt i pagent xal cleophas And sent luke to a castel go Of crystys deth as Ã¾ei fforth pas they make gret mornyng and be ful wo Than cryst Ã¾em ovyr-tok as his wyl was and walkyd in felachep fforth with hem too to them he doth expowne bothe more and las all Ã¾at prophetys spak ad of hym self Also that nyth in fay whan Ã¾ei be set with-in Ã¾e castell In brekyng of bred Ã¾ei know cryst well Than sodeynly as I ?ow tell Cryste is gon his way. 2us vexillator In Ã¾e xxxvijt i pagent Ã¾an purpos we to Thomas of ynde cryst xal apere And thomas euyn Ã¾er as ?e xal se xal put his hand in his woundys dere. 3us vexillator In Ã¾e xxxviijt i pagent up stye xal he in to hefne Ã¾at is so clere All hese Apostele Ã¾er xul be And woundere sore and haue gret dwere Of Ã¾at fferly syth Ãer xal come Aungell tweyn and comfforte hem Ã¾is is certeyn and tellyn Ã¾at he xal comyn ageyn Evyn by his owyn myth. 1us vexillator Than ffolwyth next sekyrly of Wyttsunday Ã¾at solempne ffest whych pagent xal be ix and thretty to Ã¾e apostelys to apere be crystys hest In hierusalem were gaderyd xij opynly to Ã¾e Cenacle comyng ffrom west and Est taryed not long here deth to take ful sone. 2us vexillator The xlt i pagent xal be Ã¾e last and domysday Ã¾at pagent xal hyth who se Ã¾at pagent may be agast to grevyn his lord god eyther day or nyth The erth xal qwake bothe breke and brast beryelys and gravys xul ope ful tyth ded men xul rysyn and Ã¾at Ã¾er in hast And ffast to here ansuere Ã¾ei xul hem dyth Beffore godys fface but prente wyl Ã¾is in ?our mende Who so to god hath be vnkende Ffrenchep Ã¾er xal he non ffynde ne Ã¾er get he no grace. 3us vexillator Now haue we told ?ow all be-dene the hool mater Ã¾at we thynke to play whan Ã¾at ?e come Ã¾er xal ?e sene this game wel pleyd in good a-ray Of holy wrytte Ã¾is game xal bene and of no fablys be no way now god Ã¾em save from trey and tene ffor us Ã¾at prayth upon Ã¾at day And qwyte them wel Ã¾er mede A sunday next yf Ã¾at we may At vj of Ã¾e belle we gynne oure play In N. town wherfore we pray That god now be ?oure Spede.
